info.title: Python vCon Server
info.summary: vCon pipeline processor server cluster and storage API
info.description:
The Python vCon Server installed from the Python py_vcon_server package.

The vCon server provides a RESTful interface to store and operate on vCons.
These vCon operations can be a single one-off operation or can be setup
to perform repeatable sets of operations on very large numbers of vCons.

One-off operations are performed via the vCon Storage CRUD entry points.

Repeatable sets of operations can be defined in what is called a pipeline
via the Admin: Pipelines entry points.
A queue is created for each pipeline and then jobs (e.g. vCons) are
added to the queue for the pipeline server to perform the set of processors,
defined by the pipline, on the vCon
(see the Admin: Job Queues entry points for queue managment and job queuing).
Processors in a pipeline are sequenced such that the
input to the first processor is defined in the job from the queue.
The first processor's output is then given as input to the second processor
in the pipeline and so on.  After the last processor in a pipeline has
been run, its output is commited if marked as new or modified.  Many queues,
each with a pipeline of configured processors can exist in the system
at one time.  Pipeline servers are configured to watch for jobs in
a specific set of queues.  Consequently, a pipeline server only
runs processors defined in the pipelines configured in the
pipeline server's configure set of queues.

Servers, Job Queues and In Progress Jobs can be monitored via the following entry points:

  * Admin: Servers
  * Admin: Job Queues
  * Admin: In Progress Jobs

This server is built to scale from a simple single server to hundreds
of pipeline servers.  A server can be configured to provide any one
or conbination of the following:

  * Admin RESTful API
  * vCon RESTful API
  * Pipeline server with configured number of workers

The open source repository at: https://github.com/py-vcon/py-vcon

get.description:
Get information about the server running at this host and port.

Returns: ServerInfo - attributes of this server.

Get the list of queues and related configuration for
for this server.

This is the list names of queues that this server is
actively popping jobs from and running the vCon
processors configured in the pipeline assocated with
the queue name.

Returns: dict[str, dict] - dict with keys being queue names and values are a dict of queue properties

keys for queue properties:

    weight: int - number of times to pull a job out of the
        named queue, before iterating to the next name
        queue configured for this server.

schema.title: Response Get Server Queues Names Server Queues Get

post.description:
Set the properties on the named queue on this server.

This adds or updates the properties for the queue and
identifies the queue to be processed by this server
using the pipeline associated with this queue name.

Currently the only queue property is the "weight".
weight must be an integer value and indicates how many
jobs should be popped from the named queue before
iterating to the next queue configured for this server.
Jobs are popped one at a time by the server such that
the configured NUM_WORKERS are each busy on one job at
a time.  These jobs that the server is busy on are 
called in_progress jobs.

Returns: None

delete.description:
Remove the named queue from the list of queues to process on this server.

This indicates, to this server, to ignore the queue deleted from the server's queue list.
This does not remove or modify the queue itself or the jobs contained in the queue.

Returns: None

get.description:
Get a JSON dictionary of running server states Returns: dict[server_key, ServerState] where keys are server_keys
The value associated with the server key is a dict containing server info The list may contain servers which did not gracefully shutdown. It is up to the user to remove these stale server states and clean up and requeue any in_progress jobs which the server did not complete. A pipeline of well behaved vCon processors does not commit changes until all of the pipeline's vCon processor have completed. Assuming this is the case, the following pseudo code will clean up appropriately: NOTE: This is not done automatically as it is a DEV OPS policy issue and is dependent upon potentially custom or proprietary vCon processors behavor. get the list of server states from the /servers entry point for each unique pair of server hosts and ports: get the active server key from the /server/info entry point for stale server_keys (all other server keys with the same host:port prefix): for all of the in_progress jobs having the stale server_key (entry point: /in_progress): requeue the job (entry point: put /_in_progress/{job_id} remove the stale server (entry point: delete /servers/{server_key}

schema.title: Response Get Server States Servers Get

delete.description:
Delete the server state entry for the given server_key.
This should generally only be used to clean up server states for servers that did not gracefully shutdown. Before doing this, you may want to check to see if there are in progress jobs (via the /in_progress entry point) left over for this server and requeue them. The server key is composed as: "host:port:pid:start_time".
host and port are from the REST_URL setting. Returns: None

get.description:
Get a list of the names of all the job queues.

Jobs are added to queues from which they are popped
to run through a pipeline (set of vCon processors).
The jobs pipeline server(s) pop jobs from the list
of names of queues, configured for the server to watch.
The server runs the set of vCon processors configured in
the pipeline, having the same name as the queue.
Most vCon processors create, operate on or modify
a vCon and have zero or more vCons as input and zero
or more vCons as output.

Returns: list[str] - queue names

schema.title: Response Get Job Queue Names Queues Get

get.description:
Get the jobs queued in the named queue.

These jobs are input to the pipeline, having
the same name as the queue, when a pipeline
server worker is available to work on it.

Note: this is only for montoring purposes,
Do not use this to operate on a queue as removing a job
and placing it in an in progress state should be an atomic
operation.

Returns: list[dict] - list of job objects in the queue

schema.title: Response Get Queued Jobs Queue  Name  Get

put.description:
Add the given job to the named job queue.

Currently only one job_type is supported: "vcon_uuid"
which has an array of vCon UUIDs contained in
vcon_uuid.  vcon_uuid is currently limited to
exactly one vCon UUID.

Returns: int - the positiion of the added job in the queue.

schema.title: Response Add Queue Job Queue  Name  Put

post.description:
Create the named new job queue.

You must also define a pipeline of processors (entry point
post /pipeline) with the same name as this new queue.
You must then configure one or more pipeline servers
to perform the pipeline processing for the jobs in the
queue, by adding the queue name to the set of queues
for the server to monitor (entry point /server/queues).
Without defining a pipeline and one or more servers to
perform them, the jobs will just sit in the queue.

Returns: None

delete.description:
Delete the named job queue and return any jobs that were in the queue.

Returns: list[dict] - list of jobs that were in the queue

schema.title: Response Delete Job Queue Queue  Name  Delete

get.description:
Get the list of jobs which are dequeued and supposed to be work in progress on a pipeline server.

Returns: dict - dict of in progress job objects (dict) where the keys are the unique int job id.

schema.title: Response Get In Progress Jobs In Progress Get

put.description:
Requeue the in process job indicated by its job id and
put it at the front (first to be worked on) of the job
queue from which it came.

WARNING: This does not cancel the job if it is still in
progress.
Requeing an in progress job while a pipeline server is
still working on it will have unpredictable results.

This is typically used to reschedule, rather than cancel,
jobs from  a server that has hung or died (see entry point get /servers).

Returns: None

delete.description:
Remove the in progress job indicated by its job id and
do NOT add it back to the queue from which it came.

WARNING: This does not cancel the job if it is still in
progress.
Removing an in progress job while a pipeline server is
still working on it will have unpredictable results.

This is typically used to cancel, rather than reschedule,
jobs from  a server that has hung or died
(see entry point get /servers).

Returns: None

put.description:
Add new or replace existing pipeline with the named pipeline definition.

VconProcessorOptions: bool - validate the ProcessorOptions in the pipeline.
  The default and recommendation is to validate.  However if the named 
  processor is not installed on this machine, validation will fail.

Returns: None

get.description:
Get the definition of the named pipeline from the DB.

 Parameters:
   **name**: str - name of the pipeline to retrieve

Returns:
   PipelineDefinition for named pipeline

delete.description:
Delete the definition of the named pipeline from the DB.

 Parameters:
   **name**: str - name of the pipeline to retrieve

Returns: none

get.description:
Get the list of names of all pipelines in the DB.

Parameters: none

Returns:
List[str] - names of pipelines in the DB

schema.title: Response Get Pipeline Names Pipelines Get

get.description:
Get the vCon object identified by the given UUID.

Returns: dict - vCon object which may be in the unencrypted, signed or encrypted JSON forms

schema.title: Response Get Vcon Vcon  Vcon Uuid  Get

delete.description:
Delete the vCon idenfied by the given UUID from VconStorage

Returns: None

post.description: Store the given vCon in VconStorage, replace if it exists for the given UUID

get.description:
Apply the given jq transform to the vCon identified by the given UUID and return the results.

Returns: list - containing jq tranform of the vCon.

Apply the given JSONpath query to the vCon idntified by the given UUID.

Returns: list - the JSONpath query results

post.description:
vCon decryption **VconProcessor**
This **VconProcessor** will decrypt the JWE form vCon into the signed/unverified JWS vCon form.

Deepgram transcription binding for **VconProcessor**
This **VconProcessor** will transcribe one or all of the audio dialogs in the input Vcon and add analysis object(s) containing the transcription for the dialogs.
The **Deepgram** **Vcon** **filter_plug** for transcription is used.

vCon encryption **VconProcessor**
This **VconProcessor** will encrypt the Vcon into its JWE form.

post.summary: set VconProcessorIO parameter(s) from result(s) of JQ query(s) on VconPRocessorIO input
post.description: For each name, value pair in jq_queries field in ProcessorOptions, save the result of the JQ query defined in value in the VconProcessorIO parameter in name.  The query is into a dict representation of the input VconProcessorIO.  At the top level this dict contains: 'vcons', an array of the zero or more input vCons and 'parameters', the dict of parameters in the input VconProcessorIO.

OpenAi Chat Completion binding for **VconProcessor**

This **VconProcessor** will input the text dialog and transcribed dialog(s) for one or all of the audio dialogs in the input Vcon and add an analysis object containing the generative AI output for the prompt provided in the option.
The **openai_chat_completions** **Vcon** **filter_plug** is used.

post.summary: Processor to add a job to a **JobeQueue**
post.description: A vCon_uuid Job is added to the named queue, using the UUID from the vCon at the **input_vcon_index** in the input options.
used to send SMTP messages using content from vCon or VconProcessorIP parameters.

post.summary: set VconProcessorIO parameters from process options input
post.description: set VconProcessorIO parameters from the parameters dict field provided in the processor options

vCon signing **VconProcessor**
This **VconProcessor** will with sign the Vcon using JWS.

post.summary: create a redacted vCon with the text PII redacted from the given input vCon
post.description: the PII in the input vCon is redacted using the **pii_redact** filter_plugin.  By default, the redacted transcript is not saved and the input vCon is unmodified.  A new redacted vCon is created, referencing the input, unredacted vCon.  By default the unredacted vCon is copied to the redacted vCon with the text, audio and video media in the dialogs removed.  The parts removed, is defined by a JQ query in the **jq_redaction_query** parameter.

vCon verification **VconProcessor**
This **VconProcessor** will verify the JWS signed Vcon.

post.summary: Whisper OpenAI transcription binding for **VconProcessor**  with model size: base
post.description:
Whisper OpenAI transcription binding for **VconProcessor**  with model size: base

This **VconProcessor** will transcribe one or all of the audio dialogs in the input Vcon and add analysis object(s) containing the transcription for the dialogs.
The **Whisper** **Vcon** **filter_plug** for transcription is used which is built upon the OpenAI Whisper package.
Attempt to hide abstract class
adds a new party with the Vcon Party Object parameters provided in the **AddPartyOptions**
adds a new party with the Vcon Party Object parameters provided in the **AddPartyOptions**

post.summary: Run a pipeline of processors on the vCon given in the request body
post.description:
Run the given Vcon through the named pipeline. Note: the following **PipelineOptions** are ignored when the pipeline is run via this RESTful interface: **failure_queue** assumed to be None
**success_queue** assumed to be None
**save_vcons**
Parameters: **name** (str) - name of the pipeline defined in the pipeline DB **vCon** (py_vcon_server.processor.VconUnsignedObject or py_vcon_server.processor.VconSignedObject or py_vcon_server.processor.VconEncryptObject) - vCon from body, assumes vCon/UUID does NOT exist in storage **save_vcons** (bool) - save/update the vCon(s) to the vCon Storage after pipeline processing. Ignores/overides the **PipelineOptions.save_vcons** **return_results** (bool) - return the VconProcessorOutput from the end of the pipeline Returns: If return_results is true, return the VconProcessorOutput, otherwise return None

schema.title: Response Run Pipeline Pipeline  Name  Run Post

post.summary: Run a pipeline of processors on the vCon in storage identified by UUID
post.description:
Run the vCon identified by the given UUID through the named pipeline. Note: the following **PipelineOptions** are ignored when the pipeline is run via this RESTful interface: **failure_queue** assumed to be None
**success_queue** assumed to be None
**save_vcons**
Parameters: **name** (str) - name of the pipeline defined in the pipeline DB **uuid** (str) - UUID of the vCon in the vCon Storage **save_vcons** (bool) - save/update the vCon(s) to the vCon Storage after pipeline processing. Ignores/overides the **PipelineOptions.save_vcons** **return_results** (bool) - return the VconProcessorOutput from the end of the pipeline Returns: If return_results is true, return the VconProcessorOutput, otherwise return None

schema.title: Response Run Pipeline Uuid Pipeline  Name  Run  Uuid  Post

input_vcon_index.title: VconProcessorIO input vCon index
input_vcon_index.description: Index to which vCon in the VconProcessorIO is to be used for input

should_process.title: if True run processor
should_process.description: Conditional parameter indicating whether to run this processor on the PriocessorIO or to skip this processor and pass input as output.  It is often useful to use a parameter from the ProcessorIO as the conditional value of this option parameter via the **format_parameters** option.

format_options.title: set VconProcessorOptions fields with formatted strings built from parameters
format_options.description: dict of strings keys and values where key is the name of a VconProcessorOptions field, to be set with the formated value string with the VconProcessorIO parameters dict as input.  For example {'foo': 'hi: {bar}'} sets the foo Field to the value of 'hi: ' concatindated with the value returned from VconProcessorIO.get_parameters('bar').  This occurs before the given VconProcessor performs it's process method and does not perminimently modify the VconProcessorOptions fields

private_pem_key.title: PEM format private key to use for decrypting the vCon
private_pem_key.description: Override the default PEM format private key for encrypting.

public_pem_key.title: PEM format public key/cert to use for encrypting the vCon
public_pem_key.description: Override the default PEM format public key/cert for encrypting.

input_vcon_index.title: VconProcessorIO input vCon index
input_vcon_index.description: Index to which vCon in the VconProcessorIO is to be used for input

should_process.title: if True run processor
should_process.description: Conditional parameter indicating whether to run this processor on the PriocessorIO or to skip this processor and pass input as output.  It is often useful to use a parameter from the ProcessorIO as the conditional value of this option parameter via the **format_parameters** option.

format_options.title: set VconProcessorOptions fields with formatted strings built from parameters
format_options.description: dict of strings keys and values where key is the name of a VconProcessorOptions field, to be set with the formated value string with the VconProcessorIO parameters dict as input.  For example {'foo': 'hi: {bar}'} sets the foo Field to the value of 'hi: ' concatindated with the value returned from VconProcessorIO.get_parameters('bar').  This occurs before the given VconProcessor performs it's process method and does not perminimently modify the VconProcessorOptions fields

DecryptFilterPluginOptions.title: decrypt filter method options
DecryptFilterPluginOptions.description: processor options class for **processor** method of VconProcessor wrapper for DecryptFilterPlugin **FilterPlugin**

input_dialogs.title: input **Vcon** recording **dialog** objects
input_dialogs.description:
Indicates which recording **dialog** objects in the given **Vcon** are
to be transcribed.

 * **""** (empty str or None) - all recording **dialogs** are to be transcribed.  This is the equivalent of providing "0:".
 * **n:m** (str) - **dialog** objects having indices **n-m** are to be transcribed.
 * **n:m:i** (str) - **dialog** objects having indices **n-m** using interval **i** are to be transcribed.
 * **[]** (empty list[int]) - none of the **dialog** objects are to be transcribed.
 * **[1, 4, 5, 9]** (list[int]) - the **dialog** objects having the indices in the given list are to be transcribed.

**dialog** objects in the given sequence or list which are not **recording** type dialogs are ignored.

input_vcon_index.description: Index to which vCon in the VconProcessorIO is to be used for input

This occurs before the given VconProcessor performs it's process method and does not perminimently modify the VconProcessorOptions fields

HttpErrorResponseBody.title: HttpErrorResponseBody
HttpErrorResponseBody.description: Error return type object for APIs

jobid.title: job id
jobid.description: unique (across all pipeline servers) integer job id for this in progress job

queue.title: job queue name
queue.description: the job queue name from which this in progress job was popped

job.description: the queue job that was popped by the pipeline server and initiated this in progress job

start.title: job start time
start.description: epoch seconds time at which this in progress job started

server.title: server key
server.description:
the server key to the pipeline server upon which this in progress job is running.
server_keys are of the format host:port:pid:start_time
to iterate server keys see entry point get /servers.

input_vcon_index.title: VconProcessorIO input vCon index
input_vcon_index.description: Index to which vCon in the VconProcessorIO is to be used for input

should_process.title: if True run processor
should_process.description: Conditional parameter indicating whether to run this processor on the PriocessorIO or to skip this processor and pass input as output.  It is often useful to use a parameter from the ProcessorIO as the conditional value of this option parameter via the **format_parameters** option.

format_options.title: set VconProcessorOptions fields with formatted strings built from parameters
format_options.description: dict of strings keys and values where key is the name of a VconProcessorOptions field, to be set with the formated value string with the VconProcessorIO parameters dict as input.  For example {'foo': 'hi: {bar}'} sets the foo Field to the value of 'hi: ' concatindated with the value returned from VconProcessorIO.get_parameters('bar').  This occurs before the given VconProcessor performs it's process method and does not perminimently modify the VconProcessorOptions fields

jq_queries.title: dict of JQ queries to perform on VconProcessorIO input.

JQOptions.title: JQOptions
JQOptions.description:
JOptions is passed to the jq processor when processing the VconProcessorIO.
JQOptions adds the jq_queries to VconProcessorOptions which defines the
set of querries to perform on the VconProcessorIO.

cty.title: content/media type of the decrypted ciphertext

JweUnprotectedObject.title: JweUnprotectedObject
JweUnprotectedObject.description:
JWE Unprotected Object part of JWE RFC 7516
Defined in RFC 7516 section 7.2.1

x5c.title: JWS certificate chain
x5c.description: certifcate chain in the form of an array of string defined in RFC 7515 section 4.1.6

x5u.title: JWS certificate chain URLs
x5u.description: certifcate chain in the form of an array of HTTPS URLs defined in RFC 7515 section 4.1.6

input_dialogs.title: input **Vcon** text **dialog** objects
input_dialogs.description:
Indicates which text **dialog** and recording **dialog** object's associated
transcript **analysis** objects are to be input.  Recording **dialog**
objects that do not have transcript **analysis** objects, are transcribed
using the default FilterPlugin transcribe type.

 * **""** (empty str or None) - all **dialogs** are fed into **OpenAI** model to complete the response to the **prompt**.  This is the equivalent of providing "0:".
 * **n:m** (str) - **dialog** objects having indices **n-m** are fed into **OpenAI** model to complete the response to the **prompt** 
 * **n:m:i** (str) - **dialog** objects having indices **n-m** using interval **i** are fed into **OpenAI** model to complete the response to the **prompt** 
 * **[]** (empty list[int]) - none of the **dialog** objects are fed to the the model.
 * **[1, 4, 5, 9]** (list[int]) - the **dialog** objects having the indices in the given list are fed to the the model.

**dialog** objects in the given sequence or list which are not **text** or **recording** type dialogs are ignored.

model.title: **OpenAI** model name to use for generative AI
model.description:
The named model is used to feed the transcription/text and then ask it the
given prompt.
OpenAI has numerous trained models, the latest of which may not be listed here
in examples.

You can get the current list of of available models for
your license/API key using the following:

    import openai
    openai.api_key = "your key here"
    openai.Model.list()

prompt.title: the prompt or question to ask about the transcription/text
prompt.description:
The **OpenAI** model is given text from the dialog and
given this prompt to instruct it what generative AI text
that you would like from it.
prompt.default: Summarize the transcript in these messages.

max_tokens.title: maximum number of tokens of output
max_tokens.description:
The **max_tokens** limits the size of the output generative AI text.
A token is approximately a syllable.  On average a word is 1.33 tokens.

temperature.title: **OpenAI** sampling temperature
temperature.description:
lower number is more deterministic, higher is more random.

values should range from 0.0 to 2.0

jq_result.title: **jq** query of result
jq_result.description:
The **OpenAI** completion outputs a JSON 
[Completion Object](https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference/completions/object)

The **jq_results** string contains a **jq**  filter/query string that
is applied to the output to determine what is saved in the
created **Vcon** **analysis** object.

* **"."** - results in a query that returns the entire JSON object.
* **".choices[0].text"** - results in a query which contains only the text portion of the completion output

For more information on creating **jq filters** see:
https://jqlang.github.io/jq/manual/

json_response.title: provide response in JSON format
json_response.description: If False (default) response will be in a readable text format.  If True, the response from ChatGPT will be in a JSON formatted document.  If a JSON response is desired, your prompt should specify the format of the JSON content or parameters.

analysis_type.title: the **Vcon analysis** object type
analysis_type.description:
The results of the completion are saved in a new **analysis**
object which is added to the input **Vcon**.
**analysis_type** is the **analysis** type token that is set
on the new **analysis** object in the **Vcon**.

input_vcon_index.title: VconProcessorIO input vCon index
input_vcon_index.description: Index to which vCon in the VconProcessorIO is to be used for input

should_process.title: if True run processor
should_process.description: Conditional parameter indicating whether to run this processor on the PriocessorIO or to skip this processor and pass input as output.  It is often useful to use a parameter from the ProcessorIO as the conditional value of this option parameter via the **format_parameters** option.

For example {'foo': 'hi: {bar}'} sets the foo Field to the value of 'hi: ' concatindated with the value returned from VconProcessorIO.get_parameters('bar').  This occurs before the given VconProcessor performs it's process method and does not perminimently modify the VconProcessorOptions fields

OpenAiChatCompletionOptions.title: OpenAI Chat Completion filter method options
OpenAiChatCompletionOptions.description: processor options class for **processor** method of VconProcessor wrapper for OpenAIChatCompletion **FilterPlugin**

processors.title: list of **VconProcessorConfig**
processors.description: The sequential set of **VconProcessorConfig** for the list of **VconProcessor**s that get run for this **Pipeline**

PipelineDefinition-Input.title: PipelineDefinition
PipelineDefinition-Input.description: Definition of the serialized representation of a VconPipeline

processors.title: list of **VconProcessorConfig**
processors.description: The sequential set of **VconProcessorConfig** for the list of **VconProcessor**s that get run for this **Pipeline**

PipelineDefinition-Output.title: PipelineDefinition
PipelineDefinition-Output.description: Definition of the serialized representation of a VconPipeline

timeout.title: processor timeout
timeout.description:
maximum timeout for any processor in the pipeline.
  If any one of the processors in the pipeline takes more than this number
 of seconds, the processor will be cancled, remaining processors will be
 skipped and the pipeline will be considered failed for the given job/vCon.

failure_queue.title: queue for failed pipeline jobs
failure_queue.description:
If any of the processors in the pipeline or dependant DB access fail,
 the job is added to the failure_queue if set.

success_queue.title: queue for successfully run pipeline jobs
success_queue.description:
If all of the processors in the pipeline succeed in running,
 the job is added to the success_queue if set.

PipelineOptions.title: PipelineOptions
PipelineOptions.description: Options the effect the handling of Vcon Pipeline processing.

PipelineProcessor.title: PipelineProcessor
PipelineProcessor.description: Configuration for a VconProcessor in a Pipeline

vcon_uuid.title: vCon UUIDs
vcon_uuid.description: array of vCon UUIDs (currently must be exactly 1)

input_vcon_index.title: VconProcessorIO input vCon index
input_vcon_index.description: Index to which vCon in the VconProcessorIO is to be used for input

should_process.title: if True run processor
should_process.description: Conditional parameter indicating whether to run this processor on the PriocessorIO or to skip this processor and pass input as output.  It is often useful to use a parameter from the ProcessorIO as the conditional value of this option parameter via the **format_parameters** option.

format_options.title: set VconProcessorOptions fields with formatted strings built from parameters
format_options.description: dict of strings keys and values where key is the name of a VconProcessorOptions field, to be set with the formated value string with the VconProcessorIO parameters dict as input.  For example {'foo': 'hi: {bar}'} sets the foo Field to the value of 'hi: ' concatindated with the value returned from VconProcessorIO.get_parameters('bar').  This occurs before the given VconProcessor performs it's process method and does not perminimently modify the VconProcessorOptions fields

queue_name.title: Job queue name
queue_name.description: name of the queue to put the job in

from_queue.title: From queue name
from_queue.description: name of the queue in which this processor is run.  This may be used for diagnostic purpose to track what pipeline the job came from.  This string does not effect the functionality.

QueueJobOptions.title: QueueJobOptions
QueueJobOptions.description:
QueueJobOptions is passed to the queue_job processor when processing the given VconProcessorIO.
QueueJobOptions indicates where the job is to be queued and optionally labels the queued job
with the queue from which it came.

weight.title: server's queue weight
weight.description: number of times that the pipeline server should pop a job from this queue before iterating to the server's next queue.

input_vcon_index.title: VconProcessorIO input vCon index
input_vcon_index.description: Index to which vCon in the VconProcessorIO is to be used for input

should_process.title: if True run processor
should_process.description: Conditional parameter indicating whether to run this processor on the PriocessorIO or to skip this processor and pass input as output.  It is often useful to use a parameter from the ProcessorIO as the conditional value of this option parameter via the **format_parameters** option.

format_options.title: set VconProcessorOptions fields with formatted strings built from parameters
format_options.description: dict of strings keys and values where key is the name of a VconProcessorOptions field, to be set with the formated value string with the VconProcessorIO parameters dict as input.  For example {'foo': 'hi: {bar}'} sets the foo Field to the value of 'hi: ' concatindated with the value returned from VconProcessorIO.get_parameters('bar').  This occurs before the given VconProcessor performs it's process method and does not perminimently modify the VconProcessorOptions fields

smtp_host.title: SMTP server host to connect to, to send email messages
smtp_host.description: Should be set if authentication is required.  If unset or emtpy string, the server name in the To address is used

smtp_port.title: SMTP server port to connect to, to send email messages
smtp_port.description: Should be set if authentication is required.

smtp_user.title: authentication user ID to used to login to SMTP server

smtp_password.title: authentication password to used to login to SMTP server

use_tls.title: connect to SMTP server using TLS

from_address.title: email address for sender
from_address.description: string containing From address to send message from.  Address must be of the form: 'user@host' or 'First Last \<user@host\>'

to.title: list of To email addresses
to.description: list of strings containing To address(es) to send message to.  Address must be of the form: 'user@host' or 'First Last \<user@host\>'

cc.title: list of Cc email addresses
cc.description: list of strings containing Cc address(es) to copy/send message to.  Address must be of the form: 'user@host' or 'First Last \<user@host\>'

bcc.title: list of Bcc email addresses
bcc.description: list of strings containing Bcc address(es) to blind copy/send message to.  Address must be of the form: 'user@host' or 'First Last \<user@host\>'

subject.title: subject field for the email message to be sent

text_body.title: main text body of the email message to be sent

client_hostname.title: FQHN provided for SMTP client when connecting to SMTP server.

SendEmailOptions.title: SendEmailOptions
SendEmailOptions.description:
SendEmailOptions provides the SMTP headers and message data required to send
an SMTP email message.  SendEmailOptions is passed to the send_email processor.

start_time.title: server start time
start_time.description: epoch seconds time at which this server started

host.title: server host
host.description: the server's host as configured in the REST_URL

port.title: server port
port.description: the server's port as configured in the REST_URL

start_time.title: server start up time
start_time.description: epoch seconds time at which this server started

num_workers.title: number of server worker processes
num_workers.description: the number of pipeline worker processes configured in NUM_WORKERS for this server

last_heartbeat.title: heartbeat time stamp
last_heartbeat.description: epoch seconds time for the last heartbeat on this server

input_vcon_index.title: VconProcessorIO input vCon index
input_vcon_index.description: Index to which vCon in the VconProcessorIO is to be used for input

should_process.title: if True run processor
should_process.description: Conditional parameter indicating whether to run this processor on the PriocessorIO or to skip this processor and pass input as output.  It is often useful to use a parameter from the ProcessorIO as the conditional value of this option parameter via the **format_parameters** option.

For example {'foo': 'hi: {bar}'} sets the foo Field to the value of 'hi: ' concatindated with the value returned from VconProcessorIO.get_parameters('bar').  This occurs before the given VconProcessor performs it's process method and does not perminimently modify the VconProcessorOptions fields

parameters.title: dict of parameters to set in the output from VconProcessor

SetParametersOptions.title: SetParametersOptions
SetParametersOptions.description:
SetParametersOptions is passed to the set_parameters processor and is used
to set one or more parameter values from the given dict of parameters.  The
input parameters as well as those set or overwritten by the set_parameters
processor are passed on via the VconProcessorIO to the subsquent processors
in the pipeline.

private_pem_key.title: PEM format private key to use for signing vCon
private_pem_key.description: Override the default PEM format private key for signing.

cert_chain_pems.title: PEM certificate chain
cert_chain_pems.description:
Override default PEM format certificate chain to include in the signed (JWS x5c) vCon
and used for verification of the signed vCon.

input_vcon_index.title: VconProcessorIO input vCon index
input_vcon_index.description: Index to which vCon in the VconProcessorIO is to be used for input

should_process.title: if True run processor
should_process.description: Conditional parameter indicating whether to run this processor on the PriocessorIO or to skip this processor and pass input as output.  It is often useful to use a parameter from the ProcessorIO as the conditional value of this option parameter via the **format_parameters** option.

This occurs before the given VconProcessor performs it's process method and does not perminimently modify the VconProcessorOptions fields

SignFilterPluginOptions.title: Sign filter method options
SignFilterPluginOptions.description: processor options class for **processor** method of VconProcessor wrapper for SignFilterPlugin **FilterPlugin**

input_dialogs.title: input **Vcon** text **dialog** objects
input_dialogs.description:
Indicates which text **dialog** and recording **dialog** object's associated
transcript **analysis** objects are to be input.  Recording **dialog**
objects that do not have transcript **analysis** objects, are transcribed
using the default FilterPlugin transcribe type.
**dialog** objects in the given sequence or list which are not **text** or **recording** type dialogs are ignored.

jq_redaction_query.title: JQ query defining the redaction
jq_redaction_query.description:
string containing the JQ query to apply to the input vCon
        to construct the output vCon.  The query can add, delete, modifiy the
        contents of the input vcon to define the contents of the output vCon.  The
        input vCon remains unchanged.

redaction_type_label.title: redaction type label to be set in the output vCon's redaction object

uuid_domain.title: domain string to use when generating a new UUID for the redacted vCon

input_vcon_index.title: VconProcessorIO input vCon index
input_vcon_index.description: Index to which vCon in the VconProcessorIO is to be used for input

should_process.description: Conditional parameter indicating whether to run this processor on the PriocessorIO or to skip this processor and pass input as output.  It is often useful to use a parameter from the ProcessorIO as the conditional value of this option parameter via the **format_parameters** option.

format_options.description: dict of strings keys and values where key is the name of a VconProcessorOptions field, to be set with the formated value string with the VconProcessorIO parameters dict as input.  For example {'foo': 'hi: {bar}'} sets the foo Field to the value of 'hi: ' concatindated with the value returned from VconProcessorIO.get_parameters('bar').  This occurs before the given VconProcessor performs it's process method and does not perminimently modify the VconProcessorOptions fields

TextPiiRedactorOptions.title: JQ redaction filter_plugin options
TextPiiRedactorOptions.description:
TextPiiRedactorOptions provides the filter_plugin PII redaction options which
defines how the transcript(s) is redacted for PII as well
as the filter_plugin jq query options which defines which parameters are
redacted from the original vCon.

stir.title: stir token
stir.description: stir token for the party in the call

validation.title: identity validation method
validation.description: the description or token label of the method by which the party's identity was verified

uuid.title: party uuid
uuid.description: a unique identifier for the party

role.title: role
role.description: role the party took in the conversation.  Not limited to these examples

contact_list.title: contact list
contact_list.description: name or identifier for the contact list from which this party was retrived

input_vcon_index.description: Index to which vCon in the VconProcessorIO is to be used for input

vcons_modified.title: boolean indicated if the **Vcon** in the **vcons** array has been modified from the input version

parameters.title: dict of parameters passed as input to and output from VconProcessor

VconProcessorOutput.title: VconProcessorOutput
VconProcessorOutput.description: Serializable Output results from a VconProcessor

payload.title: vCon payload in unsigned form
payload.description: Base64Url Encoded string containing the unsigned form of the JSON vCon.

payload.title: vCon payload in unsigned form
payload.description: Base64Url Encoded string containing the unsigned form of the JSON vCon.

allowed_ca_cert_pems.title: list of trusted CA PEMs
allowed_ca_cert_pems.description:
list of trusted Certificate Authority certificate PEMs to use in filter method.
In order to be valid/trusted, one of the certs in the JWS x5c certificate chain
must be a trusted CA (i.e. in this list).  Verifcation will fail if
this is not the case.

input_vcon_index.description: Index to which vCon in the VconProcessorIO is to be used for input

format_options.description: dict of strings keys and values where key is the name of a VconProcessorOptions field, to be set with the formated value string with the VconProcessorIO parameters dict as input.  For example {'foo': 'hi: {bar}'} sets the foo Field to the value of 'hi: ' concatindated with the value returned from VconProcessorIO.get_parameters('bar').  This occurs before the given VconProcessor performs it's process method and does not perminimently modify the VconProcessorOptions fields

VerifyFilterPluginOptions.title: verify filter method options
VerifyFilterPluginOptions.description: processor options class for **processor** method of VconProcessor wrapper for VerifyFilterPlugin **FilterPlugin**

input_dialogs.title: input **Vcon** recording **dialog** objects
input_dialogs.description:
Indicates which recording **dialog** objects in the given **Vcon** are
to be transcribed.

 * **""** (empty str or None) - all recording **dialogs** are to be transcribed.  This is the equivalent of providing "0:".
 * **n:m** (str) - **dialog** objects having indices **n-m** are to be transcribed.
 * **n:m:i** (str) - **dialog** objects having indices **n-m** using interval **i** are to be transcribed.
 * **[]** (empty list[int]) - none of the **dialog** objects are to be transcribed.
 * **[1, 4, 5, 9]** (list[int]) - the **dialog** objects having the indices in the given list are to be transcribed.

**dialog** objects in the given sequence or list which are not **recording** type dialogs are ignored.

output_types.title: transcription output types
output_types.description:
List of output types to generate.  Current set of value supported are:

  * "vendor" - add the Whisper specific JSON format transcript as an analysis object
  * "word_srt" - add a .srt file with timing on a word or small phrase basis as an analysis object
  * "word_ass" - add a .ass file with sentence and highlighted word timeing as an analysis object
       Not specifing "output_type" assumes all of the above will be output, each as a separate analysis object.

input_vcon_index.description: Index to which vCon in the VconProcessorIO is to be used for input
